page.title: 17Hospital Visit (Continued)
page.content: Next we went to the Special Care Baby Unit where babies which are very small and usually very ill are treated. We saw three very tiny babies. One had just had an operation on its heart at another hospital, St.Mary's. The three babies could not be fed by bottle and could only take food through a special tube. They were kept in cots called incubators and they had several plugs on them attached to machines which monitored their progress. The babies were so small they wore nappies which were much smaller than those that can be bought in the shops. Doctors and nurses working in these wards had to wear green gowns to prevent the spreading of germs. Then we went to the laundry, a huge place employing 51 people. Over 100,000 pieces of linen are washed and ironed each week. It was much too hot.
